SIDE EFFECTS FOR TIAZAC: did lower blood pressure within 2 days

REASON: Swoolen ankles and feet.  Bad leg cramps .
SIDE EFFECTS FOR TIAZAC: 180 mg is not working as well as Avapro but the side effects are a lot easier to handle

Over the years, I've taken diltiazem HCL in several forms - - generic, as cardizem and as tiazac.  All have been very satisfactory.  Unfortunately, this single drug (at 240 mg a day dosage)could not completely control my high BP. I now also take altace (5 mg/day) and HCTZ (10 mg/day) and my BP is generally 120/75. I was prescribed the HCTZ, a diuretic, because of slight ankle swelling thought to be associated with the tiazac.

REASON: swollen feet and ankles, sore muscles and joints
none that I am aware of.
